intro: Senecio vulgaris subsp. vulgaris, commonly known as common groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is an annual or biennial herb that typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring upright stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, which are followed by spherical, fluffy seed heads. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. The species is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize open habitats.
